text.tspan: Calculate the coordinates of a mitered offset given
that the vertex (a) of adjoining edges A & B is known,
and the offset distance (δ) is also known, and that
perpendicular offsets (b) and (c) from (a) are easily
derived from precalculated unit normals, and that
vector (ad) can also be derived simply by adding unit
Given that vector (ad) is known, we need to scale this
vector such that it corresponds to vertex (e), the
intersection point of the edge offsets. In other words
we need to calculate the ratio of the vector (ae) to
Let ß be the angle edge B deviates from edge A.
